page.title: 09Forestry
page.content: The main species grown are Sitka Spruce,Norway Spruce and Larches.There is much planting on both sides of the River Liza.The altititude of the plantation ranges from 700 to 1250ft and the rainfallis 230mm at Gillerthwaite. Clear felling began in 1979 and will continue in perpetuity.The areas being felled will be replanted taking into account a plan prepared by the Forestry Commision's Landscape Architect.More variety will be introduced in the species planted which will impruve the landscape appearance and enhance conservation value of the woodland.Themain markets for the forestry are Paper and Card Factories,Saw mills and local markets for stakes.
